ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned and grew my understanding significantly for Indonesian culture and the language.
I learned a lot not only about the Indonesian language, but I also learned a lot about the amazing culture of Indonesia.
This was the most Ive learned in a semester. Both linguistically and culturally. Class was good fun and always out a smile on my face to start the day.
I learned a lot about both the Indonesian culture and language.
Conversational Indonesian. More knowledge on customs, culture, and beliefs in Indonesia.
I developed a lot of new grammar skills in this level

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Hard to find any weaknesses with such a compelling Professor and insightful seminars daily.
Strengths: very engaging, fun, very collaborative, plenty of opportunities to learn and understand the language.
No weaknesses I can think of.
There were a lot of strengths in this class and with this instructor, and no weaknesses.
The course doesnt follow a syllabus or curriculum, therefore it could be more organized.

there is a lot of exciting topics of culture

I would like to practice writing skills more and transfer the grammar from l3 into a review in this course

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely. Bu Dinny cares deeply at her students learning about Indonesia as well as growing with the language. She truly hopes all her students can have the opportunity to visit indonesia.
Absolutely. The Indonesian department is amazing and always quenches my intellectual curiosities.
Yes absolutely. Learnt plenty about Indonesia and had a great time doing it.
I would certainly recommend this course. I thoroughly enjoyed each of the classes and feel as if I improved tremendously.
Yes, the class is fun an d interesting. It also opens the door to studying abroad in Indonesia.
yes it is my favorite course and Bu is incredible
